intro: Dipteracanthus linearis, commonly known as the slender dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
